column4: Trying to connect to a wireless connection on ubuntu hardy heron... help please!!
just state your problem, what you've tried and what the results were
I don't know how to access the wireless network in my house using a Dell TrueMobile 1300 card on an inspiron 1000
I've tried to connect but couldn't
did you read the wiki?
when you say you've tried what do you mean? Are you using the gnome-network applet?
I don't know what that is...
there is a little icon on the top right of the screen, it looks like a computer screen, click on this and it should allow you to select a wifi hotspot
there are no wireless hotspots available and when I try to search for one it can't find it
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HardwareSupportComponentsWirelessNetworkCardsDell
does that mean truemobile 1300 isn't available?
well it should be more of an issue with your wifi card then the hotspot
that seems to be the case... I don't know how to get my card working
I read something about NDISwrapper?
I don't have any experience with NDISwrapper, but it is a pretty common thing to fix, try googling for :NDIS Wrapper <Your Card ID> Ubuntu and I'm ceratin you'll get some hits
is my card ID truemobile 1300 or somethign else?
Am I going to have to compile something :(  I don't know how to .
HardDick: ndisgtk?
HardDisk*
its pretty easy, there should be step by step instructions
precompiled and everything?
there is also a #ndiswrapper channel, they should know more then I do
I was in it when you joined and left but no one is active :P
ok, did you check this out: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper
